body_content.explanation: to officially force a rule, tax, punishment, etc. to be obeyed or received again after a period when it was not used:
examples: She plans to reimpose regulations on energy corporations.
The curfew had been lifted on Friday but it was reimposed on Monday.

body_content.explanation: to force someone to accept something, especially a belief or way of living, again:
examples: The new regime wants to reimpose the traditional values of hard work and respect.
The police had to step in to reimpose order.
